entry.title: Industrial slash burning restrictions decrease on DFPA lands
entry.summary: Oct. 27, 2025 1:40 p.m. The Douglas Forest Protective Association has decreased its restrictions for industrial slash burning as of Monday across the Douglas District. Thanks to a persistent weather pattern of cooler temperatures and consistent rain, DFPA public information officer Rachael Pope said industrial slash burning may increase on lands protected by the agency....

entry.title: Woman allegedly threatens to fight officers at Mercy
entry.summary: Oct. 27, 2025 1:35 p.m. A Roseburg woman was arrested after refusing to leave Mercy Medical Center on Monday morning. An RPD report said that the 39-year-old was discharged from Mercy, but refused to leave. She allegedly threatened to fight the security guard and officers. entry.title: Cooler weather allows more slash-burning in Douglas District
entry.summary: A shift in weather patterns has led to a relaxation of industrial slash-burning restrictions in the Douglas District effective Monday, according to the Douglas Forest Protective Association.

entry.title: Industrial Slash-Burning Restrictions Eased in Douglas County
entry.summary: Cooler weather and rain have allowed DFPA to ease industrial slash-burning restrictions starting Oct. 27. Only industrial burns are affected; residents should check local fire departments for debris-burning rules.

entry.title: Native Innovations: Canyonville Community Library hosted traveling exhibit
entry.summary: CANYONVILLE — The Canyonville Community Library hosted the Native Innovation traveling exhibit, all the way from Eugene and the Museum of Natural and Cultural History, for most of the month of October.

entry.title: Coastal area opens for mussel harvest
entry.summary: The Oregon Department of Agriculture and the Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife announced that mussel harvest has opened from Cascade Head to the California border.

entry.summary: For Mike Malone, it's a yearly ritual: Put on the black and white suit, don the cherry red wig, slip on the polyester clown mask, grab the fake knife and take on the role of Stabby the Clown.

entry.title: Local entrepreneurs win big in 2025 Pitch Night Grand Finale
entry.summary: The 2025 Umpqua Growth Talks Pitch Night's have given a leg up to entrepreneurs in Douglas County throughout the year. In total, there were three first place winners earning $1,000 each and three second place winners earning $500 each.
